Adapted directly from the

Adapted directly from the sample help file. resampleZeroProof is a version that works even if sum of all probabilities passed to sample.int is zero. This causes an error in sample.int. This function is intended for internal use only.

resample(x, ...)

resampleZeroProof(spreadProbHas0, x, n, prob)

Arguments

x

either a vector of one or more elements from which to choose, or a positive integer. See ‘Details.’

...

Passed to sample

spreadProbHas0

/ogical. Does spreadProb have any zeros on it.

n

a positive number, the number of items to choose from. See ‘Details.’

prob

a vector of probability weights for obtaining the elements of the vector being sampled.

Contents

  • Arguments

Developed by Alex M Chubaty, Eliot J B McIntire.
